Wolf and Hope and Despair
The truth is, I am looking for someone with a stock of pyrite.
Pyrite?
Yes.
Do Not you remember what I said about Amartys method of making money?
Of course I do.
It would be too pitiable for Amarty if I were to help you too much...
Not only that.
I also remember that Deanna dislikes business talk.
I thought this was going to be business talk.
You are kidding.
But I have to know, no matter what
how to get Deanna to help me.
Are you after the alchemists' stockpile?
That is right.
Because it is so profitable?
No, that is not it.
Then you want to know your future, or heal some illness?
It is for my own personal gain.
I do not deny it.
However, my gain is not anything related to the soaring value of pyrite.
It is a more...
When our cart sinks into mud and will not budge,
we weigh the choices of abandoning it or doing whatever it takes to pull it out on a scale.
The value of the goods, the profit, the amount of cash on hand, the travel route,
as well as the cost of paying for someone is help.
On top of that, the danger of running into bandits while we are floundering around in a panic.
We take all those kinds of things into account when we are deciding whether to abandon our cargo or not.
And you are in that kind of situation right now?
Yes.
I do not want to abandon my cargo.
As long as I can load it back onto my cart,
I do not care how much trouble it causes me.
That is what I was waiting for.
Even with no time and no other way out, a good merchant will wait patiently.
Then...
I have come to buy a crate of white feathers.
Thank you!
I will definitely repay
It will be enough if you just share another ancient legend with me.
What do you think?
Did I sound as dignified as big sis just now?
Is anyone in?
Who is it?
Please excuse me for disturbing you so late.
It is Lawrence.
I visited you the other day.
I realize how rude this is, but...
I have come to buy a crate of white feathers.
I guess festivals really do attract people.
It is quite rare for me to have several visitors in one day.
You said you came to buy a crate of white feathers.
Did you hear that from Bartose?
Yes.
I was quite stubborn.
Is that so?
I do not think he is the type to give in to mere persistence, though.
What kind of business proposal was enough to persuade even that stubborn old mule?
I would like to ask your permission to buy pyrite.
The skyrocketing pyrite that everyone is talking about?
Yes, but
You have some special reason, correct?
That man would not have helped someone who was simply looking to profit.
I need the pyrite not for business, but to settle a duel.
With whom?
With...
No.
With my cargo.
Your cargo?
A traveling merchant's enemy is always his cargo.
Weighing its value, planning its handling,
and researching where it should go.
If he misjudges on any one of these points, a traveling merchant will lose out.
Right now I am trying to steady a piece of cargo that is about to fall off my cart.
Because after rethinking its value, delivery, and destination, I realized I absolutely cannot lose it.
Buy a crate of white feathers.
It is such an overblown passphrase.
It really just means that you have to entertain me a little.
A happy bird will drop feathers when it flaps its wings, right?
The people who have the passphrase pick and choose who gets to see me.
I just pick out the little details of my guests.
I do not mind.
If it is only pyrite you are after, I will allow you to purchase it.
Thank you very much!
However...
Someone has already bought some.
How much of it?
At what price?
Please calm down.
That customer bought on credit and did not actually take any goods.
You could say they merely placed an order.
On credit?
Personally I would not mind hand it over to you instead.
The amount was about 1600 Iredo worth by today's market value.
That is 400 Trenni silver worth.
Understood, what is the name of this person?
I will handle the negotiations.
For safety reasons, we do not reveal the identities of anyone doing business with alchemists.
But...!
Do you have any objections?
No.
This cannot be for something normal since you mentioned a duel, so I will do my best.
I will let you know the results as soon as possible.
Where will I be able to contact you tomorrow?
In front of the mineral merchant's stall at the marketplace.
I will be available there throughout the day's trading.
Money is no object,
as long as they do not ask for double the market value or something.
Please inform them that I am willing to pay quite generously.
I apologize for barging in on you so late.
I would not mind if you stayed all night.
As long as you brought some interesting tales.
What is the matter?
Ah, it is just...
I have a question.
Please, go ahead.
Well...
Are there any legends of pagan gods and humans becoming mates?
Yes.
Plenty.
Really?
But you are in a hurry, right?
We can discuss those stories later, at your leisure.
Yes.
Well then, I am counting on you.
Do your best.
How did it go?
I brought it up with Deanna.
But someone beat me to it so I am not sure how it will go.
Beat you to it?
So... at this point I can only rely on what you told me.
Ah... about that...
Hurry up and give your report.
Yes!
If you will pay in Trenni silver, they will sell 370 coins worth of py
Hey, you want everyone to hear it?
That is how it is.
370 Trenni silver worth?
That much?
It is nothing.
I thought about it after you left.
For someone like me without much money, it is simply a bit of pocket money.
But what about if I had some real money?
Do you think I would be able to hold back in the midst of this racket?
No, I expect there were a lot of people who secretly bought up lots of it on the side.
And they are all town merchants with their reputations on the line, not lone traders.
Buying it is not an issue, but the price rose too much so now they are at a loss as to how to sell.
The profit from selling just a small amount is huge, so it stands out.
Anyone who is sensitive of their position would be desperate to sell it off somehow.
So
A traveling merchant blinded by greed says he wants to buy pyrite with cash.
How about it?
Correct!
So what will you do?
If you are okay with it I could start negotiations right away.
Of course, right awa...
What is the matter?
No, it is nothing.
I am really sorry for everything.
Idiot.
This where you are just supposed to say thank you.
Ah, right.
Sorr...
No...
Thank you.
You have changed.
Up until recently you were a traveling merchant to the core from head to toe and inside out.
You never truly thought of me as a friend, did you?
No, that is...
But how about now?
Do I still rank as just another convenient merchant to trade with?
No.
That is why people who become town merchants after spending a long time as traveling merchants tend to fail.
But here is something even more interesting.
If you were faced with the possibility of me leaving this world,
would you be running around town this frantically?
No.
But right now,
that is exactly what you are doing for the sake of your companion.
You started traveling with that girl out of pure luck, right?
Yes.
I just accepted the circumstances as they came.
I feel like I am watching myself when I first met Adelle.
Poets say love cannot be bought with money.
Preachers say there are things more important than money.
So even though we work so hard just to earn money,
how can we obtain something so much more important than that?
Good one, Mark!
Obviously we would consider something which took great effort to obtain to be precious.
But there are times when those precious things enter our lives unexpectedly simply.
And though you did not even realize it,
you have been protecting your princess.
Being a knight is not just about physical power.
Though, because Amarty is from a good family,
you may have seen him as a knight.
Do not get so discouraged.
You are the leading actor in this story.
What are you to me?
Do you understand now?
What am I to you?
I feel like I can answer that now.
Horo, put your tail back inside would you?
Morning.
Did Mark tell you what the plan is today?
Yes.
Um...
I am helping you lay a trap for the evil villain!
Right.
I cannot go into the details but that is pretty much it.
I might need to ask you to take on a difficult task.
What is your name?
Um... Lanto!
Ewell Lanto.
You were born farther north than even here, huh?
Yes.
I came from a village frozen in snow and frost.
I see.
Lanto.
I am counting on you today.
Well...
To start with I would like a meal.
Should I go buy something?
Um...
One coin is more than enough.
The other one is for your share, little partner.
Of course, I will pay you a proper reward later too, so do not worry.
But... um...
If you keep hanging around, your master's going to come.
He would say breakfast is a luxury, right?
I will be right back!
Do not go spoiling him.
You could have stopped me.
It is pretty cold lately.
It would be troublesome if he caught a cold because I let him go hungry.
We both benefited then.
Well, his part in this is important to you.
Indeed.
For now, I intend to watch the market until noon.
If it looks like it is rising too much, I will sell enough pyrite to drop it back down.
But there is no way of knowing what the turn of events will be.
It is possible my fate will lie on Lanto's shoulders.
Look at how many prospective buyers there are!
And zero sellers!
This will keep going!
800 Iredo on average!
That is 80 times the starting value!
I was right to hold out.
Um...
Can I ask something?
What is it?
How will Lawrence win this?
First of all, do you know how an item's value rises?
When there is lot of people who want to buy it compared to the amount that is available.
And how it drops?
Conversely, when there is too much of that item.
Well, that is about right.
In reality, for a market to heat up, there needs to be a certain amount of sales.
If nobody sells then the only ones who profit are the ones who are holding back their stock.
I see.
The price goes up because there are a certain number of sales and new buyers.
That is right.
But this time, his aim is not to profit.
It is to stop Amarty from profiting.
He has to sell a large amount of pyrite at the perfect time in order to force the price to drop.
If Amarty sells even 1 second before that and achieves his target of 1000 silver, there is no hope left.
Both the ability to hold back and to make a determination are needed to time it perfectly.
Hey, hey!
It is not worth that much yet!
At this rate it is not going to stop!
The buyers are just increasing!
How many are there now?
Wait a minute, erm...
Good morning, Lawrence.
Good morning.
Even more people will gather when the market bell chimes,
so I thought I would hand this over now.
What is this?
The payment as promised.
These are Lima gold coins!
I prepared 14 coins at todays opening market rate.
It may have been presumptuous of me,
but I thought it would be inconvenient for you to carry 300 silver coins around.
The service charge for exchanging these must have been costly.
Not at all.
I consider it to be merely good manners.
Understood.
I acknowledge receipt of the payment.
Do not you wish to count them?
With that done, I would like to take the contract for the 300 silver now.
That is right...
Everything is in order.
